basics.name: Samarth Suresh Kumar
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Experienced Software Developer with a demonstrated history of working in the higher education industry. Skilled in NodeJS, .NET Framework, C#, Java,  SQL and MongoDB. Strong administrative and Analytical professional with a degree in Information Engineering and Management focused in Management Information Systems,  from Southern Methodist University.

work.summary: Tech Lead for the Yum e-commerce Developer Experience and Architecture team.

Primary Stakeholder for Yum e-commerce Platform's Supergraph API
Assume Technical Product Owner & Project Manager responsibilities for the team
Developed a graphql DGS in go-lang
Develop tools and facilitate multiple teams across the platform

Participate in Architectural design sessions
Technical Advisory and Strategy
Setup and deploy pipelines for multiple subgraphs and variants for apollo federation
Work on federated graph authorizations

work.summary: Lead Sales Tax team for Yum e-commerce Platform
highlights: Manage sales tax data for KFC US, Taco Bell US and Pizza Hut US

work.summary: Lead Sales Tax team for Yum e-commerce Platform
highlights: Tech lead for the commerce platform's Tax team
Effectively enabled brand stores by creating APIs that helped setup tax rules
Write and maintain libraries and web services (KTor) written in Kotlin
Help build and develop the payment gateway and services for Yum's E-Commerce Platform
Ensured transactions and data are within PCI
Worked with AWS's SNS and SQS to perform event-based and async transactions
Worked closely in customer's payments account management in the e-commerce platform
Communicating directly with different vendor providers
Helped in Initial E-Commerce platform to meet vendor's requirements
Built a CLI tool used by many teams within Yum's commerce platform to aid the development process
Setup integration tests and unit tests for payments services
Created multiple Grafana Dashboards to summarize micro-services health throughout the platform
Drastically reduced spinning up the local platform by optimizing docker image parallel pulls and builds
Set up features to be enabled using feature flags
Kafka integration with Kotlin services
Worked on federated GraphQL services using Apollo
Developed an SDK module in Javascript (WEB platforms) and Android for brands to easily integrate and start the payment flows in the platform
Migrated some of the payment flows to use Faktory work servers and Kafka
Leveraged CI Pipelines to do automate data entry scripts across all environments
Created a strongly typed API to author different Tax Rules to calculate taxes

work.summary: Lead backend engineer for ESI's IOT management system dashboard
highlights: Built a microservice architecture and framework from scratch using Docker, contianerd, and Kubernetes
Worked closely with Product Lead and the Director of Engineering and was involved in many technical decisions taken for the platform
Researched various API gateway solutions and implemented Express Gateway (based on Express Server)
Developed custom Authentication and Authorization plugin packages for Express Gateway
Designed session and API token management based on OAuth using JWT.
Developed and deployed AWS lambda functions using Serverless framework
Created a Kubernetes Test and staging environment for our new platform on EC2 instances using Rancher
Spearheaded the backend development for an IOT (security devices) management system dashboard.
Implemented automated unit and functional testing and ensured 100% code coverage.
Setup and maintained backend API documentation using Postman
Successfully integrated cloud monitoring and logging tools for our cloud servers - Datadog, NewRelic, etc.
Re-wrote and refactored existing Node.js application to use ES6
Participated in the hiring process to expand the engineering team
Collaborated round the clock with colleagues working remotely from different countries
Developed GraphQL APIs for various data points with pagination

work.summary: Lead Developer and Architect for Autoboard and Tantrum Street Micro-services Platform.
highlights: Developed Back office screens and components using React JS and Material UI
Developed a versioned document management systems universal to Tantrum Street's apps using S3.
Used Websockets in Mobile Apps and Web for two-factor authentication and login detections.
Designed a backend system that drives the front-end applications with the help of dynamic form elements.
Engineered, documented and deployed 300+ unique REST APIs to production
Data Modeled and architect multiple databases for various use cases (Transactions, Inventory, etc..)
Migrated apps, docker containers and images from AWS instances to Google Kubernetes Engine
Written extensions for generating front-end assets and code snippets in ReasonML for Zeplin (A popular tool used for UX/UI development)
Drastically reduced Docker Images size overheads by leaning down on layers via Dockerfiles
Deployed and managed 60+ micro-service platform deployments to Google Cloud GKE clusters
Developed several GraphQL APIs using ASPNET. Core back-end.
Building and Integrating new APIs for developers.
Redesigning and improving the Architecture from the ground up using Microservices and open source tech: Docker, RabbitMQ, C#, Kong.
Built server-side Session management using JWT.
Established an Authentication and Authorization system based on OAuth.
Scripted and Deployed multiple Kubernetes clusters on Bare metal CentOS servers
Setting up PosgtresDBs using reusable Shell Scripts.
Automating and Orchestrating deployments using Kubernetes and Docker.
DevOps - Managing and maintaining more than 15 CentOS instances.
Researching, designing and writing new software programs
Integrated existing CI with Kubernetes.
Assessing, hiring, and training new engineers.
Developing PCI compliant services.

work.position: Office Of Information Technology Support Associate
work.summary: OIT provides computing & communications resources to SMU. We offer support services to help the SMU community use technology effectively & creatively.
highlights: Providing customer service and technical support to college users using the Support ticket management system.
Installation of computer systems (Windows)
Instructional lab management ( Mac + Windows Machines )
Inventory tracking and management.
Classroom lecture recording setup.
Assistance in organizing various events in the university.

work.summary: Backend Developer in BookMyShow's cardless payment system
highlights: Technologies worked on: NodeJS, C#, MongoDB, Docker, RabbitMQ, Redis, Couch Base, IronMQ.
Experience with Virtual Cash - User + Promotional.
Migrated essential code/service to open source.
Created a RESTful API, JSON, SOAP Webservice with the help of NodeJS and Express.
Reduced failure rate of credit transactions by almost 90% by implementing a major fallback code.
Implemented Initial codebase in Node.JS + Docker for MyWallet.
Created automated programs for document processing.
Developed asynchronous transaction handling using Queues (RabbitMQ + NodeJS)
Integrated MyWallet payment systems with ATMs and third party locations.
Documentation of MyWallet.
Assisted in monthly statement generation for users.
Asynchronous and parallel processing of transaction to significantly improve performance.
Implemented API authentication for third-party API calls.
Managing and deploying open source applications on the test environment.
Developed code for generating and sending monthly statement pdfs.
Developed an android m-learning application with rich multimedia and GUI tailor-made for kids.
Featured learning alphabets, numbers, rhymes, videos, text to speech modules, etc.
